intro: Daucus pycnacanthus, commonly known as the dense-fruited parsley, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels. Its fruits are small, dry, and clustered in dense umbels, giving it its scientific name. It is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments.
